alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 18 at 3:51AM PST until December 19 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades above 4000 feet, primarily Mount Jefferson northward. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Heavy snow and gusty winds will reduce visibility at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow will likely be in the vicinity of Mount Hood, where snow levels are expected to lower to 3000 to 4000 feet tonight. Snow levels will remain much higher south of Mount Jefferson, with only light snow accumulations expected for Santiam Pass along Highway 20.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
